bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to A.S. Pinto, November 22, 1941

div1.p: Hench informs Pinto that he has too many questions to ask and so would like to meet with him personally. He has found many contradictions and omissions in the various yellow fever accounts and is trying to unravel the twisted threads.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to A.S. Pinto, November 22, 1941
div1.opener:
November 22, 1941
Dr. A. S. Pinto
1229 First National Bank Bldg.
Omaha, Nebraska
My dear Dr. Pinto:
div1.p:
For a long time I have intended to write you but I have so many
questions to ask you I decided to try to arrange to interview you personally
sometime this Spring enroute to California.

For four years I have been making a study of the work of Reed et al
in Havana, have corresponded with many of the participants, visited Kissinger
twice, General Kean twice, Miss Blossom Reed, also visited Moran in Havana twice.
I enclose a copy of an article of mine in the current Hygeia which will relate
some of the results of that study. Should you care to have more copies I'll
be delighted to send as many as you wish. If you wish a large copy (or copies)
of the painting all you have to do is to write Wyeth and Brothers and they
will send one along free.

I have run into many contradictions and omissions in the yellow
fever story (you know what they are) and have been trying to unravel the
twisted threads thereof. In this connection I hope to review some of the old
records of the Surgeon General's office in Washington when I visit there in
January. Mrs. Hench and I plan to go to California for our winter vacation--
in March probably. There we hope to visit Gen. Truby and Mrs. Lazear briefly.
While enroute to California, if convenient to you, I could stop over between
trains or for a day (a Saturday or Sunday if you prefer) and tell you what I
have been doing and if you are willing, I will bring some questions along.
I believe I will have much of interest for you.

I have read Gen. Truby's second manuscript with great interest--noted
your important comments. It will be fine when he gets it published.
div1.closer: Very sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
